quote: Never say never
author: Charles Dickens

quote: I say what I want to say and do what I want to do. There's no in between. People will either love you for it or hate you for it.
author: Eminem

quote: Each time we don't say what we wanna say, we're dying.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: Before I speak, I have something important to say.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Your words are powerful so what you say goes a long way to either establish or destroy you; this is why you should say things that God has said concerning you, not things that situations or circumstances say.
author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu,  The Prince and the Pauper

quote: let me live, love, and say it well in good sentences
author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

quote: Don't let it end like this. Tell them I said something.
author: Pancho Villa

quote: Never say no to now
author: Benny Bellamacina,  Piddly poems for children vol:3

quote: There are so many things that demand to be said. Where did you go? Do you ever think about me? You've ruined me. Are you okay? But of course, I can't say any of that.
author: Gayle Forman,  Where She Went

quote: Tell the truth, or someone will tell it for you.
author: Stephanie Klein,  Straight Up and Dirty

quote: When all is said and done, more is said than done.
author: Lou Holtz

quote: Think before you speak. Read before you think.
author: Fran Lebowitz,  The Fran Lebowitz Reader

quote: If a picture paints a thousand words, then a let a picture inspire a thousand words.
author: Nicholas Boyd Crutchley

quote: Concentrate on what you want to say to yourself and your friends. Follow your inner moonlight; don't hide the madness. You say what you want to say when you don't care who's listening.
author: Allen Ginsberg

quote: Think with your whole body.
author: Taisen Deshimaru

quote: Never say anything about yourself you don't want to come true
author: Brian Tracy

quote: If you love someone, you say it, right then, out loud. Otherwise, the moment just passes you by.
author: Julia Roberts

quote: I just want someone to hear what I have to say. And maybe if I talk long enough, it’ll make sense.
author: Ray Bradbury,  Fahrenheit 451

quote: Always tell what you feel. Do what you think...
author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

quote: I love you"I say."I love you, too"he says. "I'll see you soon.
author: Veronica Roth,  Allegiant

quote: Quiet the mind, and the soul will speak.
author: Ma Jaya Sati Bhagavati,  The 11 Karmic Spaces: Choosing Freedom from the Patterns That Bind You

quote: People are going to say what they want to say and think what they want to think, and I can't change their minds.
author: Hilary Duff

quote: Be memorable. Say something unforgettable. Be silent.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quote: If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Do for yourself, for no one else will.
author: Johanna Lindsey,  A Heart So Wild

quote: Knock yourself out... Or rather, don't.
author: Eoin Colfer,  Artemis Fowl

quote: You gotta be careful: don't say a word to nobody about nothing anytime ever.
author: Johnny Depp

quote: Don't. Don't let's pretend when there's no one around.
author: Suzanne Collins,  The Hunger Games

quote: Read great books and be great.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Read, read, read. That's all I can say.
author: Carolyn Keene,  The Secret of the Old Clock

quote: Maybe it's what we don't say/that saves us.
author: Dorianne Laux,  What We Carry

quote: What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Poirot,"I said. "I have been thinking.""An admirable exercise my friend. Continue it.
author: Agatha Christie,  Peril at End House

quote: What can I say? I prefer to die well informed.
author: Nalini Singh,  Angels' Blood

quote: If [you're asked] what you think, tell. If you have a preference, voice it. If you have a question, ask it. If you want to cry, bawl. If you need help, raise your hand and jump up and down.
author: Kristin Richter

quote: Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment.
author: Rumi,  Masnavi i Man'avi, the spiritual couplets of Maula

quote: Never Let anyone tell you that you can't; show them that you can.
author: Gloria Mallette

quote: Most good things have already been said far too many times and just need to be lived.
author: Shane Claiborne

quote: Smile out loud! Make them wonder.
author: Ljupka Cvetanova,  The New Land

quote: You shall know the truth and the truth shall make you mad.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Write,' she said, 'as if you'll never be read. That way you'll be sure to tell the truth.
author: Lori Lansens,  The Girls

quote: Speak when you are angry, and you'll make the best speech you'll ever regret.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: Tell no man anything, for no man listensYet hold thy lips ready to speak.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: A book comes and says, 'Write me.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: If you want to be happy, be.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Say what you will, 'tis better to be left than never to have been loved.
author: William Congreve

quote: Open your mind before your mouth
author: Aristophanes

quote: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Darling it may be a long time before we see one another again. But I want you to know. Every time I’ve said I love you- I meant it. There’s no two ways about it. The crew was talking about what’s ahead of us, but we all agreed on one thing. We’re coming back.
author: Kara Martinelli,  My Very Dearest Anna

quote: Just because you can doesn't mean you should.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon
